title: Chicago Cubs revenue 2001 to 2018
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes Revenue in million U.S. dollars. In total the number of data points it has is 18.
Overall Revenue in million U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.
Revenue in million U.S. dollars is gradually increasing from 2001 to 2008, roughly constant from 2008 to 2013, slightly increasing from 2013 to 2016, and finally roughly constant from 2016 to 2018.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2015 and 2016.
Maximum Revenue in million U.S. dollars, about 457.0 was reported at Year 2017
Minimum Revenue in million U.S. dollars about 131.0 was reached at Year 2001
